intro: Eleocharis arechavaletae, commonly known as the Arechavaleta sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and wetlands. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of flowers. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet, which is often subtended by a bract. Eleocharis arechavaletae is native to South America and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor, waterlogged soils.
